reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Seattle for the weekend. Our stay started out wrong at the front desk, when the executive room with king I reserved was not available. Apparently a geology conference was being held the next week. I could have two doubles executive or king regular, or a king in an odd corner room on the executive floor.
reviews.title: Nickel-and-dimed

reviews.text: We went up and looked at the oddball room which was smaller than the usual but was otherwise pretty good, nice view. We took it, and got a $25 discount and breakfast coupons too. The inconvenience was about made up for.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: In the room we noticed things like there was no fan in the bathroom, and not much heat either. There were a couple of ordinary water bottles with $5 price tags on them. It was near impossible to find channels you didn't have to pay for. Breakfast buffet would have cost $21 apiece. Parking $29 per night. And the final insult, wireless Internet for $10.95.
reviews.title: Ahotel where you feel your needs are not foremost in their minds

reviews.text: We were feeling nickeled and dimed at every turn. This surprised me because the room was not cheap in the first place. Staying there left me feeling a little ripped off, to be frank.
reviews.title: Average City Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed here both for business and leisure and have never been disappointed. My most recent stay was 2/5, and everything went very well. I've read some negative comments by others, most of which are pretty petty:
reviews.title: hilton express

reviews.text: I was alone for two over nights, found it quiet and cozy. I has a special promote code and the value for money was amazing, I still really don't know the real price per night. Strategic location and quite good friendly service.
reviews.title: best value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Hilton Seattle. We took the sky train from the airport to downtown. The Hilton was only three blocks from the downtown station where we got off. Really convenient.
reviews.title: Overnight stay at Hilton Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel check- in was on one of the upper floors. Not a problem. Check-in was easy and our room was good with an excellent shower. The hotel is not one of the fancy Hiltons around the country, but we really like the location and the price was ok. Good restaurants within walking distance. Overall we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Well located

reviews.text: The front desk staff was quiet slow and not very friendly, which is among the only things wrong with the place.Since we were staying over a weekend we enjoyed pretty nominal tariff rates.
reviews.title: Not good, Hilton. Not good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we got was clean and spacious with a nice downtown view.They could do with firmer mattresses though.
reviews.title: Great location, clean and spacious

reviews.text: I usually go out of my way to stay at Hilton's. Boy was I dissapointed with the Hilton Seattle.
reviews.title: Pretty weak Hilton

reviews.text: Location is very good. The rest kinda sucks. The Lobby is an Alamo Car rental office.
reviews.title: Hilton Seattle

reviews.text: You take an elevator to the 12th floor where the lobby there is ok at best.
reviews.title: Good location, poor condition of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are Very small, bathrooms smaller. And nothing recently upgraded.
reviews.title: Expensive but fun!

reviews.text: Breakfast free, but think Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Excellent value & convenience

reviews.text: I'm a Hilton Diamond Guy, which means I travel a lot. This is the worst Hilton I've stayed in for a long time. My room which is normally upgraded to a Junior Suite was the size of a postage stamp. I was on a business trip alone, so it wasn't horrible, but not at all what I expect. I always get two bottles of water. This time? nada. Came out of my room on my last day, and the room across from mine had two bottles outside his door. My room? nada. They claim to have a Trip Advisor Award of some sort. I don't think so.
reviews.title: I'm giving 3 stars, but should be lower!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For Hilton, this is a little different. The lobby, for instance, is on the 10th floor, above a parking garage. There is a bellman desk in the street-level entrance next to the elevators, to help guide you and assist with luggage. Location is downtown downtown, maybe 6 or 7 blocks from the water/harbor, but a steep walk most of the way. Staff was very good. No airport shuttle by the hotel, but a downtown shuttle stops there, we were told.
reviews.title: Somewhat unique

reviews.text: This is your typical Hilton Hotel. There is nothing that really stands out about it except for its central location - within walking distance of everything downtown Seattle and close to the I-5 ramps.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because the parking garage is on the first 9 floors of the hotel, the hotel lobby is on the 10th floor. There no windows (ie: natural lighting) and the dim lights make the lobby feel not very welcoming. The rooms are pretty standard but come with pretty nice views of the city. The bathroom was very small and it was difficult to close the bathroom door while I was standing inside. I also thought it was strange that the toilet didn't have a seat lid.
reviews.title: This hotel is not worthy of the HILTON name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will I stay here again? Probably since I am Hilton Honours member but this is definitely not my favourite HIlton Hotel.
reviews.title: Average Hilton that needs to be updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Seattle Hilton provides good value. Within walking distance to most of downtown. Our room was neat and clean with the usual ammenities. The shortcommings are common in city hotels. Although the room was a decent size, the bathroom was the size of a postage stamp, impossible for two people at once. Internet WiFi is available in the lobby and to top floor lounge but not in the rooms. The hotel materials say its available for a "nominal charge". However, it is only when you get to the payment page do you see its $10.95 per day. That is not
reviews.title: Close but no Cigar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "nominal".
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel right in the middle of a busy city. The rooms were very nice with a beautiful view of the city and surrounding hotels. The lounge was pleasant. We had breakfast on the top floor. WOW. Could not have been a nicer view and great service. Would definitely recommend. The only drawback was access to taxi service. We walked a short walk to the Fairmont Hotel and easily got taxi service from there.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights. Great location. Within walking distance to many sights . Room was large, clean, and the bed was very comfortable
reviews.title: Excellent location, good property.

reviews.text: Nice breakfast buffet. We were leaving at 4am for a flight and the hostess brought us boxes so we could take some things from the buffet for the next morning. There is a refrigerator!
reviews.title: Decent location, comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room here as we dropped our rental car at the alamo office.
reviews.title: overpriced for single ply loo roll
Typical Hilton
reviews.text: Was sort of expecting something better, as i hadnt stayed in a hilton before.
Best thing about the place is the location.
reviews.title: Great location if you're a shopper

reviews.text: Clean but dated rooms gave the hotel abit of a depressing feel.
reviews.title: Please refresh this property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the single ply loo roll was laughable.
reviews.title: Reasonable mid-high end hotel well placed in down town

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights on business and was pleasantly surprised. I only booked for one night thinking I might not stay given the reviews but wound up staying all 3 nights. It is just an avg. hilton, but it has a very good location and seems very reasonably priced and thus the 4 out of 5 given good value for a slightly above avg. large city Hilton. Rooms & baths were not overly small as some indicated, but again avg. The views varied greatly. The city w/ water view is what you want on a high floor. As others indicated, the breakfast on the top floor is very good and the top floor is the lounge in the evening which was significantly better than the avg. Hilton Honors Lounge. I would recommend this property particularly for HHonors members. The Homewood suites are bit further away although one is right down on the water but the water is a nice 5-8 minute walk from here. It is uphill on the way back if that is an issue.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice given all the bad reviews

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Seattle on a recent business trip. I had previously stayed at the same property several years ago and agree with other reviewers that the hotel is starting to show its age and is, therefore, in need of renovations and updates. On the plus side, the hotel is located within walking distance to downtown shops, Pike's Market, and the Monorail. The breakfast buffet on the executive floor, including the made to order omelet, is very good and there are nice city views. On the down side, the evening snack selection on the executive floor is much more limited and the on-site dinner offerings in the bar area need to be expanded.
reviews.title: Good location, but hotel needs to be updated.

reviews.text: Christine, the concierge, gave us a wonderful welcome to Seattle, and we enjoyed an excellent buffet before heading out on a day of adventure in Seattle. The traffic is unbelievable (bad), and we were unable to find a plan for doing anything to improve it. Just brace yourself for it taking 2+ hours to go 5 miles.
reviews.title: Great service, excellent breakfast & concierge; traffic a beast!

reviews.text: Booked an Executive room expecting a bit more... as others have stated the property is showing signs of its age.
reviews.title: Moderate

reviews.text: Strengths are: staff helpfulness and attitude
reviews.title: Dated but a good breakfast

reviews.text: The Hilton Seattle is located within easy walking distance of the Convention Center, the Fish Market and major department stores.
reviews.title: Good location but mediocre facilities
Enjoyed the stay
reviews.text: We stayed four nights while attending a conference at the nearby Convention Center, which is located three or four blocks away. The lobby/check-in is located on the 14th floor, as is the bar and lounge area. Check-in was painless, and the bellman (located at a desk on the ground floor) handled our luggage efficiently. Despite being a Diamond HHonors member, I was not offered an upgrade of any kind (much less to a suite). The room on the 19th floor was smallish, as was the bathroom. That said, the easy chair with ottoman and nicely appointed desk provided a reasonably comfortable stay. The bed was roomy and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Executive Lounge is located on the top floor (a restaurant which converts seamlessly to the Club after 3) and offers a pleasant view of Seattle and the Bay. Evening snacks included two hot items, some rather mediocre sandwiches, some cheeses with crackers and a couple of other items. Breakfast, on the other hand, was very good with ample offerings. Omelets and other egg offerings could be order from the congenial waiters. We ordered room service twice; acceptable food was promptly delivered.
reviews.title: Hotel on top of a PArking Garage

reviews.text: Staff in all capacities were cordial, efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Not my favorite Hilton.

reviews.text: Nice hotel, excellent professional staff especially the bellman who greeted us to help us find our way to the lobby. Very good, central location. Handy free shuttle to the cruise terminals. Short of five stars as the hotel is getting a bit dated and tired.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable and very clean
